information.name: Tyler Roosth
information.summary: Recently graduated Computer Science student from Texas A&M University, looking to put my feet in the door and explore the industry!

work.name: CopyDr
highlights: Consulted with customers, providing tailored advice for both standard and high-end business orders.
Actively participated in order creation, utilizing tools such as Photoshop and in-house machinery.
Managed a high-volume of 100+ daily customer inquiries via calls and emails, ensuring timely responses to order related questions.

work.name: Texas A&M IT Department
highlights: Provided technical support, resolving software issues promptly for faculty and students.
Demonstrated expertise in identifying, troubleshooting, and maintaining computer systems, networks, and software applications.
Led and mentored in the implementation of new technology projects, training over 5 new employees.

interests.name: My Dog
keywords: Baxter, full name, James Baxter Roosth

interests.name: Other
keywords: Creating / Editing Using Photoshop or Premiere

projects.name: Vehicle Identification for Walmart
projects.summary: Identification system used to keep track and analyze vehicles in parking lots.
highlights: Collaborated on a team to produce a Docker-based application used to keep track of Vehicles in parking lots using Python and OpenCV pipeline.
Captured, documented, and analyzed driving patterns of 500+ vehicles using live camera data (e.g., parked, illegally parked, stopped, etc.).
Stored relevant information in MongoDB databases and leveraged data analytics to optimize parking lot allocation.

projects.name: Club Registration and Database
projects.summary: Gives access to register various  accounts, certificates, and store them in a  appropriate SQL database.
highlights: Designed a web-based registration system allowing Users to create both Admin and Student accounts.
Database created using SQL, allowing quick access to retrieve and store account information.
Students and Admins are able to update their accounts with their relevant information, while Admins have full control over Student accounts.

projects.name: Colorization
projects.summary: Convert grayscale images into color via colored scribbles.
highlights: Engineered a solution to convert black and white images to color, utilizing advanced optimization techniques.
Prioritized color continuity and coherence, leveraging adjacent pixel values and statistical analysis.

projects.name: Assignment Stacker
projects.summary: Method to organize classes and assignments from different sources.
highlights: Designed a web-based application enabling students to consolidate course information from Canvas and Google Classroom, with a feature to manually add courses.
Developed the front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and back-end using Python and PHP.

projects.name: Fast Food Restaurant Database
projects.summary: Robust Fast Food Database with JavaFX GUI.
highlights: Implemented a robust database management system to manage customer orders, food inventory, and invoices.
Designed an intuitive GUI with JavaFX.
Included differentiated views for employees and managers to efficiently manage orders and inventory.
